availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David J. Rodgers (Hopkins co. farm laborer / pvt. 17th ky cav usa)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Clark County, Indiana, native. Son of Archibald Rodgers. Married to Nancy A. Robertson Rodgers in Hopkins County, Kentucky, on March 25, 1858. Father of Mary C. Rodgers, Anna B. Rodgers, and Sallie A. Rodgers. Resident in Clark County, Indiana, in 1850. Farm laborer for Colomes Robertson in Hopkins County in 1860. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from April 25, 1865, to September 20, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Clark County, New Washington, p. 66A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 824.
